title: The Surgeon's Daughter
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: As he retired, bursting with ineffectual indignation, Esdale was thefirst person whom Hartley chanced to meet with, and to him, stung withimpatience, he communicated what he termed the infamous conduct ofthe Governor's Dubash, connived at, as he had but too much reason tosuppose, by the Governor himself; exclaiming against the want of spiritwhich they betrayed, in abandoning a British subject to the fraud ofrenegades, and the force of a tyrant.
